summary: This bill, the Foreign Assistance Accountability and Oversight Act, aims to improve the management and oversight of U.S. foreign assistance. It establishes a Director of Foreign Assistance within the Department of State, appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate. The Director will report to the Deputy Secretary of State for Management and Resources and is responsible for aligning foreign assistance with foreign policy goals, promoting evidence-based policies, and leading interagency program planning. The bill also mandates timely obligation of appropriated funds.
